name: grizzly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large brown bear from the inland (= away from the coasts) part of western North America, which has a hump (= raised area) on its shoulders: The ban on hunting grizzlies remained in most states. Black bears are smaller than grizzlies.
More examplesFewer examplesDeviating from typical behaviour, these grizzlies stayed in the valley for the entire season.Grizzlies, wolves, wolverines, cougars, lynx, and other species roam freely here.Many people questioned whether there were any grizzlies left in the state.Several grizzlies in search of food at lower elevations had to be killed by wildlife officials.The research team was studying the interactions of grizzlies and black bears.

grizzly adjective
(GREY)
used to describe a person whose hair is becoming grey or white, or the hair itself: He saw the farmer's grizzly face and asked to take his picture. His grizzly facial hair has gone. Synonyms
greying (HAIR)
grizzled
More examplesFewer examplesThe team has replaced a couple of fresh faces with grizzlier ones.His old, puckered face was touched with grizzly grey hair and pinched into a thousand wrinkles.

grizzly adjective
(COMPLAINING)
UK A grizzly baby or child is crying continuously but not very loudly, or complaining all the time: If your baby is grizzly or cranky, consider what might be making them uncomfortable. She needed the money to buy medicine for a grizzly child. Related word
grizzle
More examplesFewer examplesThe baby was getting grizzly and crying.He's never been grizzly with teething before.The show was so exciting that even the most grizzly child forgot the long journey to see it.
